title: Graph voltage across resistor as capacitor charges

content.question: The capacitor C in the circuit shown above is initially uncharged. The switch S is then closed. Which of the following best represents the voltage VR across the resistor R as a function of time t?

choices.label: Choice A is a graph with vertical axis V sub R and horizontal axis t. A point epsilon is labeled at the top of the vertical axis of each graph. Choice A has a line that starts at the origin and increases linearly.

Choice B is a graph with vertical axis V sub R and horizontal axis t. A point epsilon is labeled at the top of the vertical axis of each graph. Choice B has a line that starts at epsilon on the vertical axis and decreases linearly, ending on the horizontal axis.

Choice C is a graph with vertical axis V sub R and horizontal axis t. A point epsilon is labeled at the top of the vertical axis of each graph. Choice C has a curve that starts at the origin and is increasing and concave down.

Choice D is a graph with vertical axis V sub R and horizontal axis t. A point epsilon is labeled at the top of the vertical axis of each graph. Choice D has a curve that starts at epsilon on the vertical axis and is decreasing and concave up.

Choice E is a graph with vertical axis V sub R and horizontal axis t. A point epsilon is labeled at the top of the vertical axis of each graph. Choice E has a curve that starts at epsilon on the vertical axis and is decreasing and concave down, ending on the horizontal axis.

content.answer: Choice D is a graph with vertical axis V sub R and horizontal axis t. A point epsilon is labeled at the top of the vertical axis of each graph. Choice D has a curve that starts at epsilon on the vertical axis and is decreasing and concave up.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
